intro: Chrysocephalum apiculatum subsp. undulatum, commonly known as the undulating everlasting or golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and silver-green foliage. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its compact growth habit and prolonged flowering period make it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. The subspecies undulatum is distinguished by its undulating leaf margins, which give it a unique appearance compared to other members of the species.
